class wp4.health_economics.models.QualityOfLife(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

WORK IN PROGRESS - Class definition prone to rapid change

Collects Quality of Life results for a given recipient on a specific date

Parameters

  • id (django.db.models.AutoField) – “ID”

  • record_locked (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “record locked” - Locked by the admin team. This can only be reversed by the System Administrator

  • live (livefield.fields.LiveField) – “live”

  • recipient_id (django.db.models.ForeignKey) – “recipient”

  • date_recorded (django.db.models.DateField) – “Date Recorded” - Date can not be in the future

  • qol_mobility (django.db.models.PositiveSmallIntegerField) – “Mobility” - Answer must be in range 1-5

  • qol_selfcare (django.db.models.PositiveSmallIntegerField) – “Self care” - Answer must be in range 1-5

  • qol_usual_activities (django.db.models.PositiveSmallIntegerField) – “Usual activities” - Answer must be in range 1-5

  • qol_pain (django.db.models.PositiveSmallIntegerField) – “Pain/Discomfort” - Answer must be in range 1-5

  • qol_anxiety (django.db.models.PositiveSmallIntegerField) – “Anxiety/Depression” - Answer must be in range 1-5

  • vas_score (django.db.models.PositiveSmallIntegerField) – “VAS score” - Answer must be in range 0-100

recipient¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

followup_1y¶

Accessor to the related object on the reverse side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

Place.restaurant is a ReverseOneToOneDescriptor instance.

class Restaurant(Model):

Place.restaurant is a ReverseOneToOneDescriptor instance.

class wp4.health_economics.models.ResourceLog(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

WORK IN PROGRESS

Collects the data from the Participant Resource Use Log. Acts as the central link to several smaller classes that collectively capture the data.

Parameters

  • id (django.db.models.AutoField) – “ID”

  • record_locked (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “record locked” - Locked by the admin team. This can only be reversed by the System Administrator

  • live (livefield.fields.LiveField) – “live”

  • recipient_id (django.db.models.ForeignKey) – “recipient”

  • date_given (django.db.models.DateField) – “Date given” - Date can not be in the future

  • date_returned (django.db.models.DateField) – “Date returned” - Date can not be in the future

  • notes (django.db.models.TextField) – “Notes”

hospitalisations¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.
